A urine culture revealed a significant growth of gram-negative rods, indicating a urinary tract infection (UTI). Antibiotic coverage was continued as per previous orders.

The patient experienced difficulty swallowing both pills and food, leading to the decision to keep her NPO pending a swallow evaluation.

Other medical conditions mentioned include hypertension, lower extremity edema, and schizophrenia. The patient is being managed with appropriate ICU care, including nutrition support, glycemic control, line care, prophylaxis for deep vein thrombosis and stress ulcers, and elevation of the head of bed to prevent ventilator-associated pneumonia.

1. Pneumonia
